sections.heading: Duty of school administrator. It is the duty of the principal
sections.text:
of a public elementary or secondary school, or his or her designee, and the
chief administrative officer of a private elementary or secondary school or a
public or private community college, college, or university, or his or her
designee, to report to the Illinois State Police when a student is determined to pose a clear and present danger to himself, herself, or to others, within 24 hours of
the determination as provided in Section 6-103.3 of the Mental Health and Developmental Disabilities Code. "Clear and present danger" has the meaning as provided in paragraph (2) of the definition of "clear and present danger" in Section 1.1 of the Firearm Owners Identification Card Act.

sections.heading: Immunity.  A principal or chief administrative officer, or the designee of a principal or chief administrative officer, making the determination and reporting under Section 105 of this Law shall not be held criminally, civilly, or professionally liable, except for willful or wanton misconduct

sections.text: No acceleration or delay. Where this Act makes changes in a statute that is represented in this Act by text that is not yet or no longer in effect (for example, a Section represented by multiple versions), the use of that text does not accelerate or delay the taking effect of (i) the changes made by this Act or (ii) provisions derived from any other Public Act.
